text: Michael Joseph Cullen (3 July 1931 - 3 September 2024) was a Scottish footballer. He played for Luton Town and Grimsby Town. Cullen was born in Glasgow. At the age of 17, he signed for English Second Division side Luton Town in 1948. In 1956, he became the only Luton Town player ever to be capped by Scotland.Luton Town, London Hearts. He was sold to Grimsby Town in 1958, and after a successful career there he moved on to Derby County. He moved on to Wellington Town, where he played for the rest of his career. Cullen died on 2 September 2024, at the age of 93. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Derby County F.C. players Category:Footballers from Glasgow Category:Grimsby Town F.C. players Category:Luton Town F.C. players
title: Mick Cullen
